author: Staff Reporter
text:
An exhibition-cum-sale of handlooms and handicraft products began at Kothandaraman Thirumana Mandapam in Chidambaram on Saturday.

Organised by the Crafts of India, the exhibition has Sheesham wood crafts and carpets from Uttar Pradesh, lac bangles from Rajasthan, pearls, corals and lucky stones from Hyderabad, five-metal jewellery from Karnataka, wooden toys from Andhra Pradesh, jute bags from Kolkata, terracotta items from West Bengal, leather crafts from Kanpur, agarbattis and perfume from Mysore, Rudraksha beads and puja items from Nepal, glass items from Agra, ceramics and cooking pot (Kalchatti), said a release from the organisers.

Apart from these, there are also paintings, skirts, lace work dress materials, cotton printed saris from Gujarat, bed sheets, cushion and pillow covers from Rajasthan, quilts from Punjab, bags and purses, accessories and clothes.

According to the organisers, a 20 per cent discount on handlooms and a 10 per cent discount on handicrafts were being offered to the customers. The exhibition is open from 10 a.m. to 9 p.m. till February 22.
title: Handloom exhibition begins in Chidambaram
